page.title: 04SETTLEMENT:CUMMOCK VALLEY-1
page.content:
Until about 1850 only a few people lived and worked in the Cummock Valley as pastoral farmers.
In the middle of last century coal mining brought many to live in the 'rows' which sprang up near the collieries. At one time the population must have numbered several hundred and a school was built for the children.
After 1945 a policy of rehousing the inhabitants of these villages was adopted. The people were moved to more modern dwellings in the main settlements in the Doon Valley nearby.
